item.title: Jasmine's first time in llvm land and her dotfiles
item.description: Jasmine reports on her first 3 weeks at Igalia and her dotfiles modification

item.title: Compiler (related) interview questions and nowhere to find them in 2025
item.description: Jasmine helps compiler new grads by sharing interview questions through her new grad recruiting journey

item.title: What after Kaleidoscope: Error location
item.description: Jasmine discusses a simple error/warn/log method for junior compiler writers after Kaleidoscope.

item.title: jjasmine's Gsoc GCCRS proposal
item.description: Jasmine revealed her self-hosted 2024 GSoc proposal for 'Getting into GSoc how?' and LinkedIn article

item.title: [HIATUS] Going to the gym with MLIR: Linear register allocation for ... a stackless virtual machine?
item.description: Jasmine plans out register allocation for the DEX recompiler.

item.title: [REPORT] Going to the gym with MLIR: Writing a recompiler for DEX instructions
item.description: Jas reports on her graduate compiler project: working with MLIR's SSA form, lifting DEX (with MLIR's MjolnIR) and lowering to smali.

item.title: Randomly picking the correct number somehow? An introduction into the probabilistic method
item.description: Jasmine talks about usage of the probabilistic method in games.

item.title: What I did for GSoc 2024
item.description: The article is a report of what Jasmine's done for her Google Summer Of Code

item.title: Coming out ?
item.description: Jasmine talks about how the term 'coming out' has changed over the years for her.

item.title: "Getting into GSoc how?"
item.description: Jasmine writes about the overview of getting into GCC's Google Summer Of Code 2024, from a request of a friend.

item.title: My first semester at Berkeley, a transfer experience
item.description: Jasmine talks about her first semester being an EECS transfer at Berkeley.

item.title: Building, and destroying my first website
item.description: The author talks about her (truly) first time writing a website in FullStack DeCal and how sad she is to let it go in favor of the new tech.

item.title: Jazz's rain
item.description: Short form paragraph about Jasmine's rain.
